content.description:
Start on the "red varnished hueco" shared with the neighboring problem "Mexican Affairs." Move up and right to the huge, obvious sloping rail. Throw a heel hook and mantle up to a standing position, then negotiate some tenuous holds to the topout. 

  SDS (V4): Start in large hold under roof and move into the starting hueco.
content.protection: Crash pads!  Maybe more than one as this problem has a fair bit of left-right movement.
content.location: This route is easily spotted at the right end of the second hog's back cave.  Just look for the huge slopey rail covered in chalk dust.

content.description: Start in a vertical hueco under a steep roof. Follow more vertical huecos using fun feet to get to a betaful pocket on the face. Big move to a bomber pocket, then campus your way up.
content.location: The first climb in Hog's Back Caves

content.description: A fun, short problem. Start in the slot and go left to the bomber pocket. Top out where ever is cleaver.
content.location: Near the front of the first cave in Hog's Back

content.description: Start on the "red varnished hueco" shared with the neighboring problem "Slopes." Follow good holds up and left to the top out.SDS (V4): Start in large hold under roof and move into the starting hueco.

Another CLASSIC Rogers v4. Im sure you will agree. This climb starts in a black hueco under the roof with feet on the skirt. Move out to a ledge with several hand holds and fix your feet. Throw and use the crimp and pocket to set up for the strong move to the jug and top out. Good idea to check that pocket out before hand.
content.location: In the first cave. Just beyond Sent.

content.description:
Sit down start and move through a couple sharp but deep, secure pockets.  The short crux comes at the top, where some long reaches to somewhat hidden holds help get you over the bulge. 

  It was tricky working out the beta for this but after I settled on a sequence it seemed pretty soft for V5.  Has this seen a lot of ascents lately?
content.location: Between the two hog's back caves there are two grey streaks in the stone which are riddled with two- and three-finger pockets.  This route climbs the right-hand streak.

content.description: Start in small alcove with a three finger on the left and two finger on the right. Trend right with fun feet on shallow pockets and small holds to get to a large side pull before heading straight up the face
content.protection: Several crash pads and a spotter or two
content.location: Just past the cave with "Mexican Affairs" and Slopes. Where the wall slabs out

content.description:
Sit start a few feet left of Sent in the horizontals, with an obvious good left heel. Power out the roof to a pocket, pull the roof and top out on jugs. Named after a few things lmao. May not be a first ascent but idgaf someone let me know

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pZJLelPchgo  ||  https://www.mountainproject.com/route/108337463/reflection-eternal
content.location: Left side of the first of the Twin Caves (Hog's Back Caves)

content.description: Sit start in the obvious two finger pocket at the bottom right hand outer edge of the cave. Move diagonally up and left through pockets to a big left hand side-pull (crux), move left then down-climb through the huge sloping rail of 'Slopes' to the jugs above the 'red-varnished hueco.' Top out up and left on 'Mexican Affairs.' Great fun. That line really tied the area together, did it not?
content.protection: 2-3 pads if you're alone, otherwise one massive pad and a good spotter to drag it.
content.location: Bottom right hand outer edge of the second Hog's Back cave below a heavily pocketed face. Down and right of the huge chalky rail on 'Slopes.'

climbs.name: Buckshot
climbs.fa: Blaine Burris, Chris Vinson, Merrick Ales

content.description: Make large moves off bad feet between small two finger pockets and monos.
content.location: Sit start in the obvious alcove just past the big roof/cave with Slopes and Mexican Affairs on a good 3 finger pocket/edge and a right hand undercling. Keep your feet off the skirt and on the wall instead for the full value. Climb straight up from here and top out.

content.description: The last boulder worthy walls on the cliffband that makes Rogers. Beginning with a cave, followed by another cave, and ending after several more vertical walls
